question: A block of certain mass is placed on a rough floor. The coefficients of static and kinetic friction between the block and the floor are 0.4 and 0.25 respectively. A constant horizontal force <katex>$F=20$</katex> N acts on it so that the velocity of the block varies with time according to the following graph. The mass of the block is nearly (Take <katex>$g=10 ms^{-2}$</katex>)

explanation: From the v-t graph, acceleration <katex>$a = \frac{\Delta v}{\Delta t} = \frac{20 - 0}{3 - 0} = \frac{20}{3} m/s^2$</katex>.
Since the block is moving, kinetic friction acts.
